etymologies: late 15th century: from French émeri, from Old French esmeri, from Italian smeriglio, based on Greek smuris, smiris ‘polishing powder’

definitions: a grayish-black mixture of corundum and magnetite, used in powdered form as an abrasive.
shortDefinitions: greyish-black form of corundum containing iron oxide or other impurities, used in powdered form as abrasive

definitions: denoting materials coated with emery for polishing, smoothing, or grinding
shortDefinitions: denoting materials coated with emery for polishing or grinding
